summary: This is a federal indictment against correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas for conspiracy and making false records related to their failure to conduct required inmate counts and rounds at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9-10, 2019. The indictment details how their dereliction of duty allowed Jeffrey Epstein to commit suicide while unobserved in his cell.

connections.description: Co-defendants charged with conspiring to defraud the United States by falsifying count slips and failing to perform their duties as correctional officers on the night of Epstein's death.
Noel was one of the correctional officers responsible for monitoring Epstein in the SHU but failed to conduct required counts and rounds.

Thomas was one of the correctional officers responsible for monitoring Epstein in the SHU but failed to conduct required counts and rounds. He also responded to Epstein's prior suicide attempt on July 23, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest and Detention
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and detained at the MCC on sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Epstein's Prior Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: MCC officers, including Michael Thomas, found Epstein on the floor of his SHU cell with a strip of bedsheet around his neck. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Failure to Perform Counts and Rounds
events.description: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, along with other officers, repeatedly failed to perform mandated institutional counts and 30-minute rounds in the SHU, instead falsifying count slips.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Body
events.description: At approximately 6:30 a.m., Noel and Thomas discovered Jeffrey Epstein's body in his SHU cell. He had committed suicide by hanging overnight while unobserved.

events.title: Indictment of Noel and Thomas
events.description: A grand jury indicted Tova Noel and Michael Thomas on charges of conspiracy and making false records related to their failure to perform duties on August 9-10, 2019.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), Manhattan, New York
MCC Special Housing Unit (SHU), ninth floor
keyFacts: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas were indicted for conspiracy and falsifying records by failing to conduct any inmate counts or rounds in the SHU from approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9 to 6:30 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at approximately 6:30 a.m. on August 10, 2019, having committed suicide by hanging while completely unobserved due to the officers' dereliction of duty.
The indictment states that video surveillance confirmed no officer entered the tier housing Epstein from approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9 until his body was discovered at 6:30 a.m. on August 10.
Epstein had been placed in the SHU due to risk factors for suicidality and, after a prior suicide attempt on July 23, was supposed to have a cellmate, but was alone on the night of his death.
Instead of performing duties, Noel and Thomas sat at their desk, browsed the internet for furniture sales, motorcycle sales, and sports news, and appeared to sleep for approximately two hours.
